results.title: The French horn
results.creator_credit: Milton Ingerson, Malcolm Smith and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode number 7 of Series “Basic Music Techniques”.
One of a series of films designed to assist the musician and music lover. In the film professional musicians demonstrate total range, method of playing and care of the French Horn.

results.title: Metal cutting tools: rake and clearance angles
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Basic Metalwork”.
A demonstration of the correct usage of cutting tools. Angles required for clearance to avoid rubbing, chatter and vibration are shown in detail. Rake angles used for drilling different types of metals are also demonstrated.
results.title_for_label: Metal cutting tools: rake and clearance angles

results.title: Trombone and tuba
results.creator_credit: Milton Ingerson and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode number 9 of Series “Basic Music Techniques”.
One of a series of films designed to assist the musician and music lover. Professional musicians show how the trombone and the tuba are played, demonstrate their range and tone and how to care for them.

results.title: Hard soldering
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Basic Metalwork”.
The three forms in which spelter is available; wire, strip and grain. Brazing the joints on a toasting fork. Uses of borax flux, wet and dry. Close-up shots of the brazing hearth. The heating up technique. Quenching, pickling, and cleaning up. Jointing two pipes into a T-piece. Wiring them into position. Seaming the joint on a square pipe.
results.description:
Episode of Series “Basic Metalwork”.
The three forms in which spelter is available; wire, strip and grain. Brazing the joints on a toasting fork. Uses of borax flux, wet and dry. Close-up shots of the brazing hearth. The heating up technique. Quenching, pickling, and cleaning up. Jointing two pipes into a T-piece. Wiring them into position. Seaming the joint on a square pipe.
description_for_label:
Episode of Series “Basic Metalwork”.
The three forms in which spelter is available; wire, strip and grain. Brazing the joints on a toasting fork. Uses of borax flux, wet and dry. Close-up shots of the brazing hearth. The heating up technique. Quenching, pickling, and cleaning up. Jointing two pipes into a T-piece. Wiring them into position. Seaming the joint on a square pipe.

results.title: Trumpet and cornet
results.creator_credit: Milton Ingerson, Malcolm Smith and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode number 8 of Series “Basic Music Techniques”.
Part of a series of films designed to assist the musician and the music lover. Professional musicians, Glenn Madden and Gary Foot, demonstrate how the trumpet and the cornet are played, their range and tone, and show how to care for these instruments.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Milton Ingerson, Malcolm Smith and South Australian Film Corporation
results.description:

results.title: Hardening and tempering carbon steel
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Basic Metalwork”.
Explains the reasons for and the processes involved in the hardening and tempering of three typical tools manufactured from hard carbon steel: a scraper, a cold chisel, and a screwdriver.
results.description:
Episode of Series “Basic Metalwork”.
Explains the reasons for and the processes involved in the hardening and tempering of three typical tools manufactured from hard carbon steel: a scraper, a cold chisel, and a screwdriver.
